metadata.feature_description: Configure profanity handling across all modules with options to filter content, prohibit content, or allow all content.

steps.action: Navigate to Admin > Settings > Community Settings
steps.expected: Community Settings panel should open showing Miscellaneous Community Settings section
steps.actual: Community Settings panel opened with Profanity Filtering dropdown visible showing current value 'Prohibit Content'

steps.action: Click on Profanity Filtering dropdown to view options
steps.expected: Dropdown should expand showing all three filter options
steps.actual: Dropdown expanded showing 'Filter Content', 'Prohibit Content' (selected), and 'No Filtering' options

steps.expected: Dropdown should show 'Filter Content' as selected
Settings should be saved with success notification
steps.actual: Save completed successfully with 'Item successfully saved.' notification displayed

steps.action: Select 'Prohibit Content' option from Profanity Filtering dropdown
steps.expected: Dropdown should show 'Prohibit Content' as selected
Settings should be saved with success notification
steps.actual: Save completed successfully with 'Item successfully saved.' notification displayed

steps.action: Select 'No Filtering' option from Profanity Filtering dropdown
steps.expected: Dropdown should show 'No Filtering' as selected
Settings should be saved with success notification
steps.actual: Save completed successfully with 'Item successfully saved.' notification displayed

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Save profanity filter setting and verify persistence

steps.action: Navigate away from Community Settings to Dashboard
Refresh the page completely and navigate back to Community Settings
steps.expected: Community Settings should show previously saved 'No Filtering' value
steps.actual: After full page refresh, navigated to Community Settings and verified 'No Filtering' is still selected

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify dropdown shows all available options

steps.expected: Dropdown should show all three options: Filter Content, Prohibit Content, No Filtering
steps.actual: All three options were visible in the dropdown: 'Filter Content', 'Prohibit Content', 'No Filtering'

observations: The default value observed was 'Prohibit Content' rather than 'No Filtering' (value 2). This may be because the system was previously configured, not a new installation.
All three profanity filter modes (Filter Content, Prohibit Content, No Filtering) can be selected and saved successfully.
Settings persist correctly after page refresh - verified by navigating away and refreshing the entire page.
The Save operation displays a clear success notification 'Item successfully saved.' confirming the action completed.
Testing actual profanity handling behavior (masking content vs blocking submission) would require content creation in social modules, which was not part of this UI-focused test.
